title: coinremitter
author: coinremitter
content: I think bitcoin will lead the currency market because it was created as a way for people to send money over the internet. There are many advantages of bitcoin like Direct Transfer, Greater Liquidity, Security and so on. Bitcoin's maximum supply is limited to 21 million coins. Cryptocurrency gains value when demand rises higher than supply. for that i think bitcoin will lead the currency market in near 5 years. Which currency you think will lead?

comments.author: Fiatless

Cryptocurrency gains value when demand rises higher than supply. for that i think bitcoin will lead the currency market in nearly 5 years. Which currency do you think will lead?The world of cryptocurrency is made up of two entities which are Bitcoin and the rest. Many altcoin creators have boasted that their coin will overtake Bitcoin and make the coin lose its number one spot. But all their bragging and predictions have been futile. When OneCoin came on board, its owner Ruja Ignatova boasted that in two years her coin will make bitcoin obsolete. After just a year and six months, OneCoin vanished and many investors lost billions. Bitcoin has many features that most altcoins can't copy or easily imbibe. Bitcoin will keep leading the crypto market because no altcoin has better features that can make them dethrone the king of the crypto world: Bitcoin. In five years the gap between bitcoin and other coins will keep expanding.

Which currency you think will lead?I think Ethereum will lead the currency market in the near future. Ethereum is the second-largest crypto asset by market capitalization and is seen as a viable alternative to Bitcoin. It has a wide range of use cases and is backed by a strong development team. Ethereum's transactions are faster and cheaper than Bitcoin's and its smart contract technology offers a wide range of potential applications. Ethereum also has a larger total supply than Bitcoin, making it less scarce and thus more accessible to a larger group of users. It also has a more decentralized network structure than Bitcoin, making it more resistant to censorship and manipulation,Â  Ethereum has the potential to become the leading cryptocurrency in the near future

comments.author: hZti
comments.body: If there is not a completely revolutionary new bitcoin then its is going to be bitcoin 100%. The reason is simple: If something is very popular like bitcoin you need very good arguments to get people to change to something new. If you simply improve it a little bit you will not have enough arguments to get people to change. You just need to open alt coin section to see what Im talking about.

comments.author: goldkingcoiner
comments.body: Obviously Bitcoin.Not sure if this was supposed to be a trick question, OP. Bitcoin is, was and will continue to be the backbone and the foundation of cryptocurrency. In fact, if all crypto were to somehow simply disappear tomorrow, it would not have a long term effect on the price of Bitcoin. However if Bitcoin were to disappear, all those cryptocurrencies which have Bitcoin as their asset layer would not even exist anymore. And the rest would be seen as too risky to buy because if the ultimate coin, BTC dies, all crypto would be considered dead.

We can conclude that it didn't live up to that hype, how much more if what I have said above comes true. That's why I can say that Bitcoin is always the king of cryptocurrency.
